process: The BeadStudio software was used to quantile normalize and background correct the scanned microarray image data. The data was then exported into R using the beadarray package (http://bioconductor.org/packages/2.3/bioc/html/beadarray. To avoid negative values, intensities are shifted by the sample minimum.

process: Slides were scanned using Illumina BeadStation and signal extracted using Illumina BeadStudio software.  Raw data is the output of the BeadStudio software and was analyzed using Bioconductor packages.  Data was normalized using the LIMMA package.

notes: Error in gregexpr("\t", dataLine1)[[1]] : subscript out of bounds
process: Array chips were scanned using an iScan reader, and expression data were extracted and compiled using BeadStudio software (Illumina). Raw data were analyzed by using Bioconductor packages as previously described (Coppola 2011). Quality assessment was performed by examining the interarray Pearson correlation and clustering based on the top variant genes was assessed.
